title: How babies learn to talk
intro: What do babies need to learn to be able to talk? Georgie and Phil discuss this and teach you some new vocabulary.
this_week_question: At what age do babies usually start babbling?
a)    around 6 months old? b)    around 9 months old? or, c)    around 1 year old?
Listen to the programme to hear the answer.

vocab.desc: meaningless noises and sounds which babies make as they start learning to speak
sound within a word which is emphasised by being spoken longer, louder or higher than the other sounds
perfect or most typical example of something which has all the features which you expect such a thing to have
accept or assume something without question
having more than one possible meaning; being open to interpretation
